page.title: 07Education All Saints School
page.content: The original School building is Victorian and a stone tablet gives the date as 1849.It was probably one large room with smaller rooms at the rear. The school has seen many changes.The origanal building was converted to a kitchen and boiler house,and staff offices and newer classrooms have been added during the last twenty years.The present school has five classrooms,a hall,headteacher's room and staffroom. It also has a large playing field.The school roll now stands at one hundred. About half of the children come from the immediate village and the other half from R.A.F. Swinderby which is situated about three miles away.R.A.F. children travel to school by bus. Children usually start school just before their fifth birthday and leave after their eleventh birthday.
